Formula Expressions

Formula expressions are metrics that you define yourself as a function of other existing metrics. For example, let’s say you wanted to view your Gross Margin percentage in a report, but there was no pre-defined metric for it. Here is how you can define one in BIQ:

1.       In the Report Definition panel, you will see a formula icon in the top right. When you click on it, a formula editor window will appear. You can also click on the formula icon in the columns panel and then click ADD. This will allow you to automatically create a re-usable formula expression. 

2.       In the formula editor window, type in the desired column name

3.       Click on the existing metrics from the menu that you wish to use in deriving your new metric. In the formula bar (marked with an f(x) icon), you can type in parentheses and/or arithmetic operators (+-/*)

4.       Click the VALIDATE button to verify your formula structure

5.       Once your formula is validated, specify whether you would like the resulting figures demonstrated as a percentage (%), real number, or currency ($)

6.       Specify the number of decimal places to display, if needed.

7.       Click OK

After step 6, you should see something similar to the following:

 

When you click OK, the column will now show up in your Report Definition. To edit the formula expression you just created, click on the column name in the Report Definition to expand the menu, and then select the pencil icon to revise the formula definition.
